intro: Carphobolus, commonly known as the arrowhead plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves, which are usually alternate and have a smooth or slightly serrated margin. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white or pink in color. Carphobolus species are often found in wet or marshy environments, thriving in moist soils. They are sometimes cultivated as ornamental plants due to their attractive foliage and resilience to wet conditions.
